rationale: The segment does not contain an intensifier or comparative adjective directly modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment describes symptoms/effects using a plain verb ('experience').
The segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
The segment reports factual information about symptoms but contains no explicit calming cue.
Segment does not contain a minimiser + scale contrast.
The segment describes symptoms in infected birds but contains no bare negation.
The segment describes symptoms in infected birds.
The segment reports on symptoms, not primarily prices or metrics.
The segment describes symptoms, not speculation about future relief or improvement.
Attributed statement but no framing language. Describes symptoms factually.
Factual description of symptoms without added alarmist language.
